required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Utilization of Simulated Grid (SimGrid™) Technology for the Reduction of Ionizing Radiation Dose on X-ray Examination in Obese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Utilization of Simulated Grid (SimGrid™) Technology for the Reduction of Ionizing Radiation Dose on X-ray Examination in Obese Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to learn if a new imaging processing technique called Simulated grid (SimGrid™) will help in getting better quality X-ray images in obese subjects. The GM85 digital radiography machine will be used to obtain X-ray images.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality of conventional grid versus SimGrid using 5 point Likert scale
primary_outcome.description: Relative image quality will be assessed using a 5 point Likert scale ranging from -2 to +2 with -2 indicating better image quality with conventional grid and +2 indicating better image quality with SimGrid.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality of non-grid versus SimGrid using 5 point Likert scale
primary_outcome.description: Relative image quality will be assessed using a 5 point Likert scale ranging from -2 to +2 with -2 indicating better image quality with non-grid and +2 indicating better image quality with SimGrid.

arm_group.arm_group_label: X-ray imaging with physical grid using conventional processing
X-ray without physical grid using conventional processing
X-ray imaging without physical grid using experimental SimGrid

intervention.intervention_name: X-ray imaging with physical grid using conventional processing
intervention.description: X-ray imaging with physical grid using conventional processing
intervention.arm_group_label: X-ray imaging with physical grid using conventional processing

intervention.intervention_name: X-ray imaging without physical grid using conventional processing
intervention.description: X-ray imaging without physical grid using conventional processing
intervention.arm_group_label: X-ray without physical grid using conventional processing

intervention.intervention_name: X-ray imaging without physical grid using experimental SimGrid offline processing
intervention.description: X-ray imaging without physical grid using experimental SimGrid offline processing
intervention.arm_group_label: X-ray imaging without physical grid using experimental SimGrid

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients at clinic who needed chest radiography for continuation of care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese adult volunteers with Body-Mass Index (BMI) exceeding 30
- subjects that require at least one X-ray for continuation of care
Exclusion Criteria:
- subject who is known to have lung disease(s) which would interfere with the interpretation of the chest radiography image
- subject who is pregnant or breastfeeding

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
